thread.title: Jaworski's newest tavern set for grand opening in Pittsgrove
thread.title_full: Jaworski's newest tavern set for grand opening in Pittsgrove

title: Jaworski's newest tavern set for grand opening in Pittsgrove
text:
Jaworski's newest tavern set for grand opening in Pittsgrove Daniel J. Kov, @dailyjournalkov 2:53 p.m. EDT October 19, 2015 Buy Photo File: Golfers drive out to their tees for the shotgun start of the Edgarton Christian Academy golf tournament at Running Deer Golf Club in Pittsgrove Township. (Photo: Staff Photo/Sean M. Fitzgerald) Buy Photo 42 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
PITTSGROVE - The township's newest tavern is set for its grand opening Wednesday. 
7 Tap & Tavern will officially open at 5 p.m. inside the Running Deer Golf Club located at 1111 Parvin Mill Road. 
Members of the public are invited to join host Ron Jaworski and participate in the festivities, which will include complimentary sampling of signature dishes and appetizers; craft beers and local wines; contests and giveaways. 
. (Photo: Submitted photo) 
"We are very proud and excited to showcase this great new addition to Running Deer Golf Club," Jaworski said in a news release. "7 Tap & Tavern, like its namesake at Blue Heron Pines Golf Club, is a fun, friendly neighborhood tavern featuring craft beers, a terrific menu and large screen TVs. It's not your ordinary sports bar." 
A live broadcast of Jaworski's radio show on The Fanatic 97.5 FM will begin at 5 p.m., along with the ribbon cutting ceremony. 
The tavern will remain open following the grand opening celebration with drink and food special offerings. 'Happy Hour' specials will last from 5 p.m. until closing. Running Deer to hold U.S. Open local qualifier in 2017 
"7 Tap & Tavern is conveniently open to the public seven days a week, and we look forward to becoming the place to eat, drink and relax for golfers, local businesses and the neighboring community," Liz Jaworski, President of Ron Jaworski Golf, added. 
Golfers may also start the celebration earlier with a 9-hole shotgun start at 3 p.m. 
For more information, visit www.runningdeergolfclub.com or call (856) 358-2000.
